summary: Nothing required except a mouse or keyboard capable of executing a macro.  I use a Logitech G600 mouse now, but I have also used this technique with a Razer Naga Epic mouse.  I was very pleased with how fast and effective it was in-game.  You will probably have to create the macro manually, but it is not too difficult.  Just use your mouse software
descriptionHtml:
I have searched and searched for something simple and direct, but there is no cam to see the front view of your character while moving in Skyrim, not really.
video               https://youtu.be/8H0_lSem044
This is what is in the download file:
================================
Nothing required except a mouse capable of executing a macro.  I use a Logitech G600 now, but I've also used this technique with a Razer Naga Epic.  I was very pleased with how fast and effective it was in-game.  You'll have to create the macro manually, but it's not hard.  Just use your mouse software.

Started out with 0.03 second delay
(each key you press shows a down and an up, I put a 
0.01 second delay between the downs and ups
and 0.02 between each letter.
At the end of the word ANIMCAM I put a 0.03 second 
delay, pressed enter and then delayed a tenth of a second 
before exiting with the enter/exit console command.

Basically what it is typing is
`
ANIMCAM
`

It is taking less than 1 second to execute when assigned to a button on 
the mouse in the logitech gaming software for the G600 mouse (I use the G7 button and it works pretty well). 

The macro commands look something like this:
0.03 sec delay
`
0.01 sec delay
`
0.05 sec delay
A
0.01 sec delay
A
0.02 sec delay
N
0.01 sec delay
N
0.02 sec delay
I
0.01 sec delay
I
0.02 sec delay
M
0.01 sec delay
M
0.02 sec delay
C
0.01 sec delay
C
0.02 sec delay
A
0.01 sec delay
A
0.02 sec delay
M
0.01 sec delay
M
0.03 sec delay
Enter
0.01 sec delay
Enter
0.1 sec delay
`
0.01 sec delay
`
=================================
author: Sycamore
